Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is located on the popular and well-established Lynx Trading Estate, situated towards the southwestern outskirts of Yeovil. The property fronts onto the A3088 Lysander Road, a main arterial route into the town centre from Cartage Link Road, which links the town with the A303. Major commercial occupiers in the vicinity include Screwfix, Euro Car Parts, Edmondson Electrical, Topps Tiles, Magnet, Dulux and many other national trade counter operators.

Lynx Trade Park comprises five newly refurbished trade counter units occupying a highly prominent roadside location fronting onto the A3088 Lysander Road. Each unit benefits from a front-loading area and 11 allocated car parking spaces, accessed via Garrett Road. The scheme offers the following benefits:

Established trade counter destination

Very prominent location with main road frontage

Excellent transport links

Fully refurbished to shell specification including new roof and WC

Units available individually or combined

Good car parking and loading areas

Close to major retail and trade counter operators

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: ONLY 2 UNITS REMAINING - JOIN TILEFLAIR, REXEL UK & GREGGS

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: UNIT 6_ ARTILLERY ROAD_ LUFTON TRADING ESTATE - SITEPLAN

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Location
Unit 6 is situated on Lufton Trading Estate, a well-established industrial / trade counter location on the Western side of Yeovil, the prime employment area for the town due to its road connectivity to both the A37 and A303 via the A3033.

Description
+ Detached trade counter unit, incorporating integral WC, kitchenette, and office areas
+ Two self-contained semi-detached warehouse units to the rear, at separate levels
+ Covered storage extension to warehouse units
+ Large self-contained secure fenced site
+ Marked car parking provision within secure site
+ Steel portal frame construction with brick / concrete block / steel profile sheet elevations
+ Pitched steel profile sheet roof, with 20% translucent roof panels
+ Suspended strip lighting
+ We understand that mains services are provided to the property including water, drainage and 3 phase electricity
+ EPC Rating E 111

Travel Distances
+ A37 – 1.8 miles (2.9 km)
+ Yeovil Town Centre – 2.7 miles (4.3 km)
+ A303 – 5 miles (8.1 km)
+ Junction 25 of M5 Motorway – 22.6 miles (36.4 km)
+ Taunton – 26 miles (41.8 km)
+ Bournemouth – 50.2 miles (80.7 km)
+ Bristol – 41. 3 miles (66.5 km)
+ Exeter– 52.2 miles (84 km)

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: UNIT 6_ ARTILLERY ROAD_ LUFTON TRADING ESTATE - MAIN
UNIT 6_ ARTILLERY ROAD_ LUFTON TRADING ESTATE - REAR
UNIT 6_ ARTILLERY ROAD_ LUFTON TRADING ESTATE - INTERNAL1
UNIT 6_ ARTILLERY ROAD_ LUFTON TRADING ESTATE - INTERNAL2

Dynamic.PrimaryImage.Common.ImageCaption: UNIT 6_ ARTILLERY ROAD_ LUFTON TRADING ESTATE - MAIN

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Location
The property is situated on A38, the primary arterial route into Taunton from the M5 Motorway, via A358 and is located in a mixed residential and retail area with excellent prominence, approximately 1 mile east of Taunton Town Centre and 1.2 miles south of Taunton Rail station. 

Description
+ Secure site with terraced trade counter and warehouse accommodation
+ Trade counter / showroom is broadly open plan, with small stores, office and WC’s
+ Additional terraced warehouse / ancillary accommodation
+ Construction comprises a mix of clear span concrete & steel portal frame with
+ pitched roof incorporating translucent roof panels
+ Warehouse buildings providing varying eaves height from 4.15m to 5.9m
+ Multiple roller shutter loading doors
+ Extra large roller door measuring 7.3m wide and 4m high
+ Dual access from the main A38 East Reach to the front and Victoria Gate to the rear
+ LED lighting throughout
+ May suit alternative use redevelopment, subject to any necessary consents
+ Yellow shaded area within demise plan is granted via a Deed of Grant, dated 13th December 1970 until 29th September 2069, providing right of way to 61 East Reach, via Victoria Gate
+ Main terraced trade counter & warehouse buildings EPC C 70
+ Semi-detached warehouse / industrial buildings EPC C 69
+ We understand mains services are provided including water, drainage, gas (to main terrace trade counter & warehouse) and electricity (separate supplies to main terrace trade counter and warehouse and semi-detached warehouse / industrial building to the rear of the site)

Travel Distances
+ Taunton Town Centre – 1.1 mile (1.8 km)
+ Junction 25 of the M5 motorway – 1.9 miles (3 km)
+ Bridgwater – 10.8 miles (17.4 km)
+ Exeter – 39.4 miles (63.4 km)
+ Bristol – 47.9 miles (77.1 km)

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Warehouse / Industrial / Trade Counter Development Opportunity

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: MERLIN INDUSTRIAL PARK UNIT 4_ VENTURE WAY - PROMAP

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Location

Unit 4 is sutuated within a large well-established and main trading estate in Taunton. The location has excellent access to A38, Junction 25 of the M5 motorway, Taunton Railway Station and Taunton town centre.Nearby occupiers include Howdens, Wolseley, Magnet, Eurocell, Nationwide Platforms, Plumbase, City Plumbing Supplies, Marshalsea Engineering, and Western Power Distribution.

Desrciption

Unit 4 is a mid terrace warehouse industrial unit incorporating trade counter, incorporating integral ground floor WC’s, kitchenette, and offices. The construction is clear span steel portal frame with brick/block cladding and replacement pitched steel profile roof with 20% translucent roof panels. The unit benefits from has a 6.08m eaves height, 5.47m minimum clear height, 7.21m to the apex, an electric sectional up and over roller shutter loading door measuring 3.93m wide by 4.84m high and double glazed personnel door/windows.

Travel Distances

+ Taunton Railway Station – 1.30 miles (2.10 km)
+ Taunton Town Centre – 1.80 miles (2.90 km)
+ Junction 25 of the M5 motorway – 2.40 miles (3.80 km)
+ Bridgwater – 11.40 miles (18.30 km)
+ Exeter – 35.80 miles (57.70 km)
+ Bristol – 57.90 miles (93.20 km)

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: MERLIN INDUSTRIAL PARK UNIT 4_ VENTURE WAY - MAIN

Dynamic.PrimaryImage.Common.ImageCaption: MERLIN INDUSTRIAL PARK UNIT 4_ VENTURE WAY - MAIN

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: THE OLD MARKET_ NORTH STREET_ LANGPORT - PROMAP

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Location

Prominently situated fronting A378 North Street in the centre of Langport, close to the junction with the A372 and adjacent to Tesco superstore. A378 connects to A358 which provides access to Junction 25 of the M5 motorway and Taunton. A372 connects Bridgwater with the A303 and A37, at Podimore just to the north of Yeovil.

Description

The Old Market is a detached workshop / industrial / trade counter unit, with incorporating trade counter, timber trade counter extension, steel portal frame warehouse, stores, timber lean-To & first floor offices. The warehouse has a 3.03m eaves and 2.52m clear internal height with a loading door measuring 4.04m wide by 2.51m high. The property benefits from a large rear secure fenced yard with concrete / tarmacadam surface and a large front car park with 16 marked spaces with potential for more.

Travel Distances

+ Junction 25 of the M5 motorway – 11.90 miles (19.10 km)
+ Bridgwater – 12.20 miles (19.70 km)
+ Taunton – 14.70 miles (23.70 km)
+ Yeovil – 13.50 miles (21.80 km)
+ Bristol – 58.80 miles (94.70 km)

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: THE OLD MARKET_ NORTH STREET_ LANGPORT - MAIN
THE OLD MARKET_ NORTH STREET_ LANGPORT - WAREHOUSE
THE OLD MARKET_ NORTH STREET_ LANGPORT - YARD

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: UNITS 1 _ 2_ FESTIVAL UNITS_ SHOWGROUND BUSINESS PARK - SITEPLAN

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Location
The property is situated in an established industrial location with excellent access to A38 Taunton Road which connects directly to junction 24 of the M5 Motorway and provides access north towards Bridgwater Town Centre. Nearby occupiers include SIG, MailaDoc and Nagel Group, Royal Mail, GAP Plant & Tool Hire and Falcon Vehicle Solutions.

Description
+ Modern end and mid terrace warehouse / industrial units
+ Steel portal frame construction with steel and blockwork clad elevations
+ Steel profile sheet roof
+ 20% translucent roof panels and LED lighting
+ 6.85m eaves height, rising to 8.8m at the apex
+ Integral ground and first floor office accommodation
+ incorporating ground floor WC’s, stores and workshop
+ 22 car parking spaces
+ We understand mains services are provided including water, drainage, gas & 3 phase electricity
+ Unit 1 EPC rating C 72
+ Unit 2 EPC rating C 61

Travel Distances
+ Junction 24 of the M5 motorway – 0.9 miles (1.4 km)
+ Bridgwater Town Centre – 1.7 mile (2.9 km)
+ Bridgwater Rail Station – 1.8 miles (3 km)
+ Hinkley Point C Power Station – 12 miles (19 km)
+ Bristol – 40.3 miles (65 km)

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: UNITS 1 _ 2_ FESTIVAL UNITS_ SHOWGROUND BUSINESS PARK - MAIN

Dynamic.PrimaryImage.Common.ImageCaption: UNITS 1 _ 2_ FESTIVAL UNITS_ SHOWGROUND BUSINESS PARK - MAIN

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Location

- Situated to the front of Williton Industrial Estate, with housing opposite.

- Located just off the A39 / Long Street, adjacent to Williton rail station.

- Less than half a mile North East of Willition Town Centre.

- Approximately 16-17 miles from both Taunton and Bridgwater.

- Less than 20 miles from Junction 24 of the M5 motorway via A39.

- Less than 20 miles from Junction 25 of the M5 motorway via A358.



Description

- Main trade counter / showroom building with offices above

- Separate detached warehouse / industrial building

- Comprises a substantial secure concreted, fenced and gated site

- Main trade counter / showroom is broadly open plan, with small ground floor stores, small ground floor office / WC’s, and first floor offices / WC’s

- Detached warehouse / industrial building constructed with clear span steel portal frame

- Pitched roof incorporating 10% translucent roof panels

- 4.94m eaves height, 4.05m minimum clear height, 4.05m eaves height, rising to 8.02m at the apex

- Two up and over roller shutter loading doors measuring approximately 4.25m wide and 4.15 – 4.24 m high



Travel Distances

- Williton Town Centre – 0.5 mile (0.8 km)

- Minehead – 10.0 miles (16.1 km)

- Taunton – 16.2 miles (26.1 km)

- Bridgwater – 17.4 miles (27.9 km)

- Junction 25 of the M5 motorway – 19.2 miles (30.9 km)

- Junction 23 of the M5 motorway – 19.8 miles (31.8 km)

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: WAREHOUSE / INDUSTRIAL / TRADE COUNTER / DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITY

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Central Approach is situated in the South West’s premier logistics location and it is host to several national and international occupiers. The site is located between Junction 1 of the M48 and Junction 18 of the M5. This well-established distribution park benefits from fast and easy access to the M4 and M5 motorways.

 Works to connect junction 1 on the M49 are due to complete in Q2/Q3 2021, which will deliver direct access into Central Park and Western Approach. This in turn will provide for a faster route onto the national motorway network. Central Approach is within 1 mile and a 3-minute drive of the new junction.

 The site is suitable for B1(c), B2 and B8 uses.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: High Quality Premises To Let / For Sale
